intro: Cheiranthus dillenianus, commonly known as the Dillenian's winter cress, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Cheiranthus dillenianus is typically found in moist, disturbed soils and can thrive in rocky or woodland habitats.
